source: 最后跑了一趟代收点才把电脑搬回来。
target: In the end, I had to run for a generation to get the computer back.
annotation:
MQM annotations:
minor: culture-specific reference/literal translation - The phrase "run for a generation" is a literal translation of the Chinese word 代收点, which refers to a package collection point, often a local store or postal service outlet acting as a third-party receiver. This translation is nonsensical and doesn't convey the meaning of picking up the package from such a location in English. It sounds like someone ran for a very long time. A more natural rendering would be something like "package collection point" or "parcel locker".

source: 首先说一句刚买了几天就发现降价了，差评，本还算不错，性价比高，cpu和显卡足够应付主流网游和相当一部分大型单机了，散热非常好，但屏幕有点漏光(ips屏的通病)，音响质量不太好，硬盘不好(建议自己花点钱加个固态)，昨天拿去售后检测了一下硬件，没有任何问题，自带的win8.1不太好用，建议升级成10，卖家发货很快，各项询问回答的也很快，收到电脑第二天发票就到了，不错，可惜什么赠品都没有。
target: First, just a few days after purchasing, we saw that the price has been reduced, poor reviews, this is still quite good, the price is relatively high, the cpu and graphics card are enough to cope with the mainstream internet games and a considerable part of large single computer, the heat dissipation is very good, but the screen has a little leakage (the epidemic of the screen IPS), the sound quality is not good, the hard drive is not good (recommended to spend a bit of money on adding solid state), yesterday to check the hardware, there is no problem, the win8.1 is not very good, recommend to upgrade to 10, the seller ships quickly, all enquiries are answered very quickly, the next day the ticket received, good, sorry, but there is no gift for the computer.
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: None
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "the epidemic of the screen IPS" is a mistranslation of "ips屏的通病", which means "the common problem of IPS screens".
[Minor]: accuracy/addition - "sorry, but there is no gift for the computer" is an addition. The source text "可惜什么赠品都没有" translates to "Unfortunately, there were no gifts." The addition of "sorry, but there is no gift for the computer." adds unnecessary information and changes the tone slightly.
```

target: First, just a few days after purchasing, we saw that the price has been reduced, poor reviews, this is still quite good, the price is relatively high, the cpu and graphics card are enough to cope with the mainstream internet games and a considerable part of large single computer, the heat dissipation is very good, but the screen has a little leakage (the epidemic of the screen IPS), the sound quality is not good, the hard drive is not good (recommended to spend a bit of money on adding solid state), yesterday to check the hardware, there is no problem, the win8.1 is not very good, recommend to upgrade to 10, the seller ships quickly, all enquiries are answered very quickly, the next day the ticket received, good, sorry, but there is no gift for the computer.
annotation:

Style Errors:

minor: unnatural flow - "a considerable part of large single computer" sounds unnatural. A better phrasing would be "a considerable number of large single-player games".
minor: unnatural flow - "the epidemic of the screen IPS" is an incorrect and unnatural way to describe IPS screen bleed. A better phrasing would be "a common problem with IPS screens".
minor: unnatural flow - "the ticket received" is awkward. "the invoice arrived" would be better.
minor: unnatural flow - "sorry, but there is no gift for the computer" is an unnatural ending. "Unfortunately, there were no free gifts included" would be better.
```

source: 货收到几天了，物流信息还是10几天后你将会收到货！
target: It's a matter of days to receive the goods, it's still a matter of 10 days to get the logistics information, then you will get the goods!
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: None
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "It's a matter of days to receive the goods" is a mistranslation of "货收到几天了". A more accurate translation would be "I received the goods a few days ago".
[Minor]: accuracy/mistranslation - "it's still a matter of 10 days to get the logistics information, then you will get the goods!" is a mistranslation of "物流信息还是10几天后你将会收到货！". A more accurate translation would be "The logistics information still says you will receive the goods in more than 10 days!".
```

The source text indicates that the logistics information is outdated or inaccurate, showing an expected delivery date that is far in the future, even though the goods have already been received. This suggests an issue with the tracking system, not a literal 10-day wait.

source: 收到的时候封口胶条状态看着就很不对，像是拆开过，赶紧先拍了照，果然一撕就开了，打开后里面的纸板还有损坏，担心是别人退的，还没到纪念日就赶紧先给老公试试了，结果机器一点电都没有，还好刀头里面没有胡渣，要不大老远的咋退啊！
target: When you receive it, the state of the cap was very wrong, it was as if it had been opened, hurried to take a picture, then it was ripped open, opened and the cardboard inside was damaged, worried that someone else had turned it back on, before the anniversary day, it was rushed to try it on the husband, the machine had no electricity at all, it was better to have no scrap inside the head of the knife, if not a big long-distance backlash!
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: accuracy/mistranslation - "the state of the cap" for "封口胶条状态" (the state of the sealing strip). The translation focuses on the "cap" rather than the "sealing strip," which is more accurate in describing the adhesive strip used to seal the package.
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "turned it back on" for "退的" (returned). The translation misinterpreted "退的" which refers to returned product, instead, it translated it as turn it back on.
[Minor]: accuracy/addition - "it was better to have no scrap inside the head of the knife, if not a big long-distance backlash!" is an awkward addition. The original text "还好刀头里面没有胡渣，要不大老远的咋退啊！" means "Luckily there was no stubble in the cutter head, otherwise it would be difficult to return from so far away!".
```

source: 其次，这个鞋子品控真的不敢恭维，一只鞋底胶有破损，另外一只鞋面有各种擦痕还有个针眼，鞋面与鞋底连接处胶条错位，明摆着的以次充好！
target: Secondly, this shoe is a bit of a bad taste control: one toe is broken, the other has scratches, a knob, the toe and the sole have gotten in the wrong place, and everything has been well done.
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: None
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "this shoe is a bit of a bad taste control" for "这个鞋子品控真的不敢恭维". The translation fails to capture the meaning of "品控不敢恭维," which indicates poor quality control. A more accurate translation would be something like "the quality control of this shoe is really disappointing."
accuracy/mistranslation - "one toe is broken" for "一只鞋底胶有破损". The original text refers to the adhesive on the sole being damaged, not the toe itself being broken.
accuracy/mistranslation - "a knob" for "有个针眼". "针眼" refers to a pinhole, not a knob.
accuracy/mistranslation - "the toe and the sole have gotten in the wrong place" for "鞋面与鞋底连接处胶条错位". This translation doesn't accurately convey that the glue strip connecting the upper and sole is misaligned.
accuracy/mistranslation - "and everything has been well done" for "明摆着的以次充好". This completely misses the meaning of "以次充好," which means passing off inferior goods as superior ones.
[Minor]: None
```

source: 非常满意，非常喜欢，亚马逊海外购都是正品毋庸置疑，质量也非常好，物美价廉，买的放心，售后服务很周到，客服态度都很亲切和蔼，处理问题耐心高效，完美解决后顾之忧，配套的快递送货上门非常便捷稳妥，送货师傅很替顾客着想，每次都会提醒及时从快递柜中取货，感谢亚马逊给顾客提供如此舒适的购物体验。
target: very satisfied, very interested, Amazon overseas purchase is authentic and no doubt, the quality is very good, the product is cheap, the purchase confidence, after-sales service is very thoughtful, customer service is very friendly and friendly, handling the problems is patient and efficient, perfect after care is perfect, supporting the express delivery to the door is very convenient and orderly, delivery assistant is very thoughtful about the customer, and every time is reminded to pick up the goods from the express cabinet, thank you to Amazon for offering customers such a comfortable shopping experience.
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: None
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "very interested" should be "very satisfied" or "very fond of". The original Chinese is "非常喜欢", which directly translates to "very like" or "very fond of", but in context, it's used to express a high degree of satisfaction.
[Minor]: accuracy/mistranslation - "the product is cheap, the purchase confidence" should be "value for money, and gives confidence in the purchase". The Chinese phrase "物美价廉" means "good quality and cheap", which is commonly translated as "value for money." The phrase "买的放心" means "buy with confidence".
accuracy/mistranslation - "perfect after care is perfect" should be "perfectly resolves concerns". The original text, "完美解决后顾之忧", translates to "perfectly solves worries/concerns about the future."
accuracy/mistranslation - "delivery assistant" should be "delivery person". The Chinese text "送货师傅" literally means "delivery master" but should be translated as "delivery person".
```

source: 昨天收到快递，亚马逊买的，标注的是EMS运送，最后是天猫的快递送过来的，这是转了多少个弯？亚马逊和天猫关系还不错？
target: I received it through the mail yesterday, bought it on Amazon with the mark EMS shipping, and then the mail came from Tmall, how many tiles has this changed?
annotation:
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: None
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "how many tiles has this changed?" for "这是转了多少个弯？". The phrase "转了多少个弯" means "how many turns did it take?" or "how many detours were there?". The translation misinterprets this idiom.
[Minor]: None

source: 昨天收到快递，亚马逊买的，标注的是EMS运送，最后是天猫的快递送过来的，这是转了多少个弯？亚马逊和天猫关系还不错？
target: I received it through the mail yesterday, bought it on Amazon with the mark EMS shipping, and then the mail came from Tmall, how many tiles has this changed?
annotation:
MQM annotations:
minor: culture-specific reference/idiom - The phrase "how many tiles has this changed?" is a literal translation of a Chinese idiom (转了多少个弯？) that means "how circuitous/indirect was this process?". While understandable, it's not a natural or common way to express this in English and sounds awkward. A more natural English phrasing would be preferred for audience appropriateness.

source: 再说一下包装，就是用保鲜膜包了几层，里面连个包装塑料泡泡纸都没有，打开一看，所有的零件就放在空荡荡的盒子里，还好玩具质量不错，没有坏掉的零件，就是比想象中的小太多了，因为不是带电池的，手推着经常脱轨，感觉轨道两边空隙太大，设计不合理。

The "try again" part implies a previous failed attempt, which isn't present in the original Chinese.

source: 我联系厂家问手表在入库有核对时间吗?他们回复说“有”，既然有，那为啥时间相差那么多，那肯定是手表没有精确度，简单地说就是水货产品，不是我说的难听，看嘛，很明显的质量问题（数字显示不完全）都拿出来卖，是不是垃圾货。
target: I contacted the manufacturer and asked if they have check time on the stock? They replied that if the watch has a check time, then the check time is so different, it's definitely the watch that doesn't have accuracy, simply put, it is a sea-going product, not what I said it was not difficult to hear, well, it was obvious quality problems (the numbers were not complete) were sold out, it was not rubbish cargo.
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: None
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "sea-going product" for "水货产品" (shui huo chan pin). This term refers to counterfeit or smuggled goods, not necessarily goods related to the sea.
[Minor]: accuracy/mistranslation - "check time" is not a natural way to express the idea of verifying the time during stocktaking. It should be something like "time verification" or "time check".
accuracy/addition - "well," is added and doesn't reflect the original meaning.
accuracy/mistranslation - "not what I said it was not difficult to hear," is an awkward and inaccurate rendering of "不是我说的难听" (bu shi wo shuo de nan ting), which means "it's not that I'm trying to be harsh."
accuracy/mistranslation - "it was not rubbish cargo" is an inaccurate translation of "是不是垃圾货" (shi bu shi la ji huo). A more accurate translation would be "is it junk/trash?".
```

source: 我联系厂家问手表在入库有核对时间吗?他们回复说“有”，既然有，那为啥时间相差那么多，那肯定是手表没有精确度，简单地说就是水货产品，不是我说的难听，看嘛，很明显的质量问题（数字显示不完全）都拿出来卖，是不是垃圾货。
target: I contacted the manufacturer and asked if they have check time on the stock? They replied that if the watch has a check time, then the check time is so different, it's definitely the watch that doesn't have accuracy, simply put, it is a sea-going product, not what I said it was not difficult to hear, well, it was obvious quality problems (the numbers were not complete) were sold out, it was not rubbish cargo.
annotation:
MQM annotations:
minor: culture-specific reference/idiom - The term "sea-going product" is a literal translation of "水货产品" which refers to grey market goods or counterfeit products. While the literal translation is understandable, it's not a natural or common way to express this concept in English. A more appropriate translation would be "unofficial product," "grey market product," or "counterfeit product," depending on the specific meaning intended.
minor: style/awkward - The phrase "not what I said it was not difficult to hear" is awkward and unclear. A better phrasing would be "I'm not trying to be harsh," "I'm not mincing words," or simply removing the phrase entirely.

source: 以前用过一块西铁城的，感觉一两年也不会差几秒。

annotation:
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: None
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "western iron" is a mistranslation of "西铁城 (Xītiěchéng)," which is the Chinese name for the watch brand Citizen.
[Minor]: accuracy/mistranslation - "it feels like it won't last a second more than a year or two" is a mistranslation of "感觉一两年也不会差几秒 (gǎnjué yī liǎng nián yě bù huì chà jǐ miǎo)," which means "it feels like it won't be off by more than a few seconds in a year or two." The original sentence refers to the accuracy of the watch, not its durability.

source: 肯定是正品，去专柜验过货，表的外观很漂亮，做工精细，用料足，加上又是进口机械机芯，所以是有一定的分量的，是那些三四百所谓的机械表不能比的，这个是货真价实的。

```

source: 老婆没手机用难受死了，第二天一早6点多叫我在想想办法，后来上京东一看256G有货可以当天送到，只得立马再订购一台。
target: My wife didn't have a mobile phone, so she died, so the next morning she called me at around 6am thinking of a way to fix it, and then I went to Tokyo to see if the 256G could be delivered the same day, but only by ordering another one right away.
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: accuracy/mistranslation - "My wife didn't have a mobile phone, so she died" is a severe mistranslation of "老婆没手机用难受死了". The original sentence means "My wife was extremely upset/distressed that she didn't have a mobile phone."
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "Tokyo" is a mistranslation of "京东(Jingdong)", which is a Chinese e-commerce company.
[Minor]: no-error
```

source: 老婆没手机用难受死了，第二天一早6点多叫我在想想办法，后来上京东一看256G有货可以当天送到，只得立马再订购一台。
target: My wife didn't have a mobile phone, so she died, so the next morning she called me at around 6am thinking of a way to fix it, and then I went to Tokyo to see if the 256G could be delivered the same day, but only by ordering another one right away.
annotation:
MQM annotations:
major: accuracy/mistranslation - "My wife didn't have a mobile phone, so she died" is an over-the-top translation of "老婆没手机用难受死了". A more natural translation would be "My wife was really upset about not having a mobile phone." The phrase "难受死了" is an exaggeration and doesn't literally mean "died." This could be considered an audience appropriateness issue as it presents an unnaturally dramatic tone.
minor: style/awkward - "and then I went to Tokyo to see if the 256G could be delivered the same day, but only by ordering another one right away." The phrase "went to Tokyo" should be translated to "went to JD.com," so the translation does not provide the correct translation of the original text.

source: 很久以前就看中这个摄像头了，但是因为除了价格外，还有一些别的原因，所以没有购买，这次因为凑包邮，价格也还可以所以就买了。
target: I noticed this camera a long time ago but I didn't buy it for other reasons besides the price, so I bought it because of the packaging and the price.
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: none
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "because of the packaging" should be "to get free shipping". The phrase "凑包邮" means to combine purchases to reach the minimum amount required for free shipping.

```

MQM annotations:
minor: culture-specific reference/omission - The phrase "凑包邮" (凑单包邮) refers to combining purchases to reach a minimum amount for free shipping. While the translation mentions "packaging," it misses the core concept of combining items for free shipping, a common e-commerce practice in China that might not be as prevalent or understood in other cultures. This is a minor issue, as the general context is still understandable.

source: 买来之后其他的都没什么问题，就是在软件连接的时候，怎么都连不上，我家是TP的路由器，上网查了之后发现好多人都有这个问题，弄了两个多小时，各种改路由器的设置，最后我用360WIFI作为媒介给弄好的，期间给小米客服打电话，他们对这个问题也没有什么解决方法，直接就让我联系亚马逊进行售后。
target: After buying it I had no problem whatsoever with the other problems, it was not connected during the software connection, my house is TP's router, after searching the web I found out that many people have this problem, and after more than two hours, I changed the settings of the router, and finally I used 360 WIFI as a medium to fix it, during which I called the Xiaomi customer service, they did not have any solution to this problem, and let me contact Amazon directly after sales.
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: none
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "After buying it I had no problem whatsoever with the other problems" is a mistranslation of "买来之后其他的都没什么问题". A more accurate translation would be "After buying it, everything else was fine".
[Minor]: none
```

source: 买这个手机的时候，想想两个当时感觉，还是能一起同甘共苦，但现在却是不堪回首，人生或许就是这样吧，有些人一辈子都不想遇到，有些事儿一辈子都不想知道，可是有什么办法呢？
target: When I bought this phone, I thought of how it felt then, that you can still share the pain of the same time, but now it's unbearable, and perhaps that's the way life is, some people don't want to meet for the rest of their lives, and some things they don't want to know for the rest of their lives, but what is the solution?

[Critical]: no-error

[Minor]: no-error
```

source: 买这个手机的时候，想想两个当时感觉，还是能一起同甘共苦，但现在却是不堪回首，人生或许就是这样吧，有些人一辈子都不想遇到，有些事儿一辈子都不想知道，可是有什么办法呢？
target: When I bought this phone, I thought of how it felt then, that you can still share the pain of the same time, but now it's unbearable, and perhaps that's the way life is, some people don't want to meet for the rest of their lives, and some things they don't want to know for the rest of their lives, but what is the solution?

source: 多少次一看到三星这个手机，脑海就想起她，那种痛苦就随之而来灌满全身，我从没舍得用过超过2千元的手机，可是买给她的时候，却毫不犹豫，对一个人再好，可是有天当她变心了，所有的山盟海誓也就烟消云散了。
target: Every time I see the Samsung phone, I think about her, and that pain fills my body with it. I've never been able to spend over 2 thousand yen on the phone, but when I bought it for her, I didn't hesitate to say goodbye to one person, but one day when she changed her mind, all of her promises vanished.
annotation:
```
MQM annotations:
Accuracy Errors
[Critical]: no-error
[Major]: accuracy/mistranslation - "I've never been able to spend over 2 thousand yen on the phone" should be "I've never been willing to spend more than 2 thousand yuan on a phone" because the original text mentions 元 (yuan), not yen. This changes the meaning significantly.
[Minor]: accuracy/mistranslation - "didn't hesitate to say goodbye to one person" is a mistranslation of "毫不犹豫". "毫不犹豫" means "without hesitation," and in this context, it means the speaker didn't hesitate to buy the phone for her, even though it was expensive. The phrase about "saying goodbye to one person" is an incorrect interpretation and doesn't reflect the original meaning.
```
